result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice D Wade

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Maurice D Wade in court.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Maurice D Wade.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Calendar Call. Parties provide an update to the court. Court withdraws previous stayed bench warrant. Defense counsel requests an a Plea/Sentencing hearing date, due to reasons put forth on the record. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Maurice D Wade not in court.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Maurice D Wade.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for calendar call in Branch 16; IN PERSON.  Calendar call scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maurice D Wade in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared by video means. Case is calendared for a plea and sentencing. Defense is requesting an adjournment as the defendant has stated that he is ill. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights/Addendum to plea questionnaire/waiver of rights

Jury instructions for plea hearing

Defendant Maurice D Wade in court via zoom.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  The scheduling conference was held OFF THE RECORD.  Defense has discovery, the state's offer and requesting a plea and sentencing date via zoom. The court order the matter adjourned back to Branch 16 via zoom.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Email correspondence with parties. Case re-scheduled for Scheduling Conference on 04/28/2022, Br 16.

Defendant Maurice D Wade in court with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland; both appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Reagan.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Maurice D Wade in court.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.

Defendant Maurice D Wade in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/1/22 @ 2p
